title: You just can't get the staff these days: Why are companies finding it so hard to hire chief executives?
text:
If there’s one company that is in need of an old-fashioned, no-holds-barred turnaround, it’s troubled banknote printer De La Rue.

Welcome then new boss Clive Vacher, a seasoned “turnaround expert” with such an impressive track record that no one has ever heard of him, at least not anyone outside the closed world of the aerospace industry.

His CV is equally underwhelming. Although, to be fair to Vacher, he has held senior positions at some big names such Pratt & Whitney and Rolls Royce, his most recent job was as boss of Dynex Power, a tiny Canadian semiconductor-maker that was taken private earlier this year after consistently racking up losses.

How that equips him to tackle a basket case like...
